Reviews.Title: “Paris in the spring A la Hyatt Regency Madeleine”
Reviews.Author: tvlingchef
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Paris - Madeleine is a five star hotel because it has five star associates at your service twenty-four hours a day. Melina Ospina went out of her way to assure we dined at Maxim's, Romaine Sitzia, was there every morning smiling with suggestions for everything from great bakeries to a great place to get a haircut, he had our taxis waiting for us wherever we wanted to go. Baptiste Masot took care of our train tickets to Bordeaux and Sophie Ardennes searched until she found the restaurant with the best Canard Confit that fit into our busy Easter schedule. The breakfast buffet was stellar all seven mornings. Fresh, Natural, Healthy Food! Ludivine Ughetto helped us get off to the airport in time and provided us with the correct spelling of everyone’s name that had assisted us all week. Hyatt Regency can buy all of the best amenities, beautiful design, pricey real estate and the finest accouterments to make a stunning hotel and trust me when I tell you that they have spared no expense at The Hyatt Regency Paris – Madeleine. But no amount of money can make a five star hotel…. Only the people that work there that really care about the place and its guests can do that, and the fine men and women of Team Madeleine have certainly raised the bar in Paris when it comes to unsurpassable professional outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Upscale Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArtandArtist
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Madeleine. It is a modern, sophisticated ,designed hotel with many business people staying there. But as tourists, it also offered us a quiet respite to bustling Paris. We walked and took the metro everywhere from there. The staff were WONDERFUL !! We felt most welcomed, they were very gracious to us. Top rate staff, beautiful hotel, great location. Look forward to someday returning...

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a quiet street which is within walking distance of major Metro stations and the Place de Concorde/Champs Elysees. It is excellent as a business hotel. The rooms are smaller than what a normal Hyatt room is but it is comfortable and all amenities are available.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: albert m
Reviews.Content: Pros : Tastefully decorated, very comfortable bed, very clean and beautiful hotel , and rather nice bathroom. I enjoyed the breakfast very much. Cons : the rooms are really too small, even if we are in Paris. Be carefull, the hotel doesn't have a pool, which disappointed me. Good location next to the Madeleine.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to the Place de la Concorde”
Reviews.Author: JasonNyilas
Reviews.Content: The rooms were modern, quiet and the bed was comfortable. The rest of the hotel is well furnished and inviting. A lovely fireplace in the foyer with an intimate feel after a day out in Paris greets a weary guest with shopping-sore feet. Place de la Concorde is a ten minute walk and the local shops are very upmarket. You have to leave the area though to start to feel the essence of Paris. A good place to stay if you use Hyatt points. Otherwise, I would pay the same price to be a bit closer to the action.

Reviews.Title: “big room for Paris standards”
Reviews.Author: dtshura
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel,small but very elegant & cosy,fabulos champagne bar & restaurant.the room are huge,comfortable and very well decorated. I can recommend the hotel for those who know Hyatt standards and expect good night's sleep. Considering the pricing, in Paris it is not cheap, but it's not gambling either. In Paris you might end up surprising places, still paying a lot. It's a safe bet for quality conscious traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Three Star Hotel Prentending to be a Five Star”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelFR
Reviews.Content: Let me first start off by saying, given a choice of five-star or even four-star properties in Paris, this hotel shouldn't be one of your considerations. The location of this hotel is "OK", but not ideal or on par with other five star properties in Paris. I've lived in Paris several times, and travel there for business often. Therefore I can honestly say if you are truly seeking a five star property there are many other hotels in better locations, closer to the metro, and offer better amenities, facilities, and service. Even knowing all of this I decided to give this property a go. I'm a Diamond member with Hyatt and never staying here before, thought why not try something new. Sadly that wasn't the best decision. Like many hotels in Paris, this property is fairly small. The size of the property isn't its downfall; it's the management and operations of this property. A smaller hotel means fewer rooms, fewer staff to manage, and fewer guests to look after. Combine all of that with this claiming to be a five star property, and one would expect an exceptionally well-run property with outstanding service. Surprisingly this couldn't be further from the truth. I experienced issues with virtually every customer touch point this property offers. I was assigned an appropriate room; I don't think my reservation had even been looked at until I arrived on-site. I was "kicked" out of their restaurant and exiled to their Champagne bar while entertaining business clients because I wanted to have a coffee. Their cleaning staff wasn’t the most efficient and their breakfast buffet is beyond basic. To all my fellow Diamond members, if you are use to being treated like a valued guest and dealing with staff that have been properly trained on Gold Passport policies, then this most definitely isn't the property for you. I spoke with two managers and both were completely clueless on basic Gold Passport policy and procedures. I eventually had to make a call to Hyatt Corporate who then contacted the property and educated them on very standard Hyatt policies. It’s truly sad when a guest knows your own company’s policies better than your own managers. Not only is that tragic, but it’s unbecoming of a five star property. I stay 300 nights a year in hotels, so I have a good understanding on what makes a five star property. All in all I personally rate this hotel a three star parading around as a five star. I’m sure it could probably skin by as a four star property but a five star it most certainly isn’t. So save yourself some money and hassle and book elsewhere. You’ll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Will58
Reviews.Content: This smallish Hyatt in the Madeleine is wonderful. The staff were all extremely helpful and efficient. The hotel is charming - from the glass roof lobby atrium restaurant to the generous and lovely rooms. The location is very good. I have found that the Hyatt Regency properties are very much hit or miss. This is a hit. I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Perefect”
Reviews.Author: RCrumb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this Hyatt for a week in Oct 2011 and were treated like royalty. Great hotel, I highly recommend it, and lovely staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but wasn't such a fan of the hotel itself”
Reviews.Author: Travelchica23
Reviews.Content: Pros: The location is great, good walking distance to a lot of cafes and shops as well as the Louvre. - the staff was helpful - the bathroom was nice, although the toilet didn't flush well at all... there could just be toilet paper in it and it wouldn't go down without flushing 10 times. Cons: - the hallway had an odd smell, like smoke and cleaning chemicals combined. - the heat was so hot, even though we had it turned off, we had to sleep with the windows open in January - we used points to stay for free and they put us in a tiny back closet of a room. Upon exiting the elevator, at the very end of the hall, there is a door you need a key to open - when you open that door, you are in a very small space with 2 rooms each with their own key - we stayed in one of these rooms. This configuration where basically our entrance was shared with another room was very obnoxious - people were extremely loud coming in and out of the room next to us, which was no doubt amplified by the tiny space. A couple nights the people in the room next to us had children screaming (playing) until past midnight. The fact that this is the type of hotel where kids can scream and run up and down the hallways until past midnight should speak volumes. - the bed was hard and not very comfortable. - the breakfast is extremely expensive in the hotel.... and not very good. Do yourself a favor and eat at ANY of the little cafes around here..... much better value. Breakfast buffet was 72 euro for 2 people and was NOT worth that, and a glass of wine at the bar at night was 17 euro. This is a huge rip off. The best thing was the location. Overall I would say the experience was extremely average and if I were in Paris again, I would not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not the typical Hyatt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michele3062
Reviews.Content: We arrived Dec 28 for 6 nights we had connecting rooms for our children.The hotel is lovely but not the typical Hyatt hotel .We did not know it was a boutique hotel so very small.The staff were helpful .The rooms are on the small side but great shower.We had new years eve there for dinner that was also nice .Overall the location service rooms were ok.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Paris and after our stay here, definitely won't be our last!!”
Reviews.Author: GSXRLacey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 5* plus all the way! If I could have graded a 10 I would have done! Service, staff, food, hotel style and deco etc ALL excellent! We were loyal to Marriott over the years, but now we will always stay at the Hyatt without a shadow doubt!! We only planned to come to Paris once but because of our experience at this outstanding hotel (and of course the shopping at louboutin round the corner!)we will be back. In all the hotels I have stayed at around the world, this hotel had the most friendly, obliging staff I have ever experienced and they are always happy, every single one of them! Highly recommend you stay here! I will be going back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, great location, lovely rooms!”
Reviews.Author: AussieBizTraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in Dec 2011 on our honeymoon, and not knowing the precincts od Paris before we booked, were very happy to stay in La Madeliene. The hotel itself is lovely, rooms are quiet and elegantly fitted out, a little small, but common in Europe. The bar downstairs is lovely, but expensive for afternoon drinks, try the truffle cheese toasties. La Madeleine was 20 mins walk to the Musee De Armee, the Eiffel Tower, and about 10 mins walk to the Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique-y hotel with good design and easy location”
Reviews.Author: Barbara M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights on business. My room was very small but as a solo traveler all I needed was a comfy bed (check!) quiet (check!) good shower (check!), fast internet (check but $$$) and free coffee (yes! check!) My room was overlooking the courtyard so very quiet. The free coffee is great- you need to join Hyatt Passport and then you get free coffee service delivered to your room, anytime. Tres bien. The design is clean and modern but not overly modern. The lobby is really gorgeous and unique. Why not 5 stars? Well the service on our last day was not great. Our called taxi at 7:30 am was a no-show and we were standing out in front of the hotel by ourselves with our luggage unsure what to do as there were no taxis around. It was strange that there was no doorman. After about 20 minutes we finally got someone inside the hotel to radio our taxi and help us. For a 5-star hotel that is just a miss on the service, thus the 4-bubble rating. (A minor note for this hotel- get good hairdryers for women travelers! The ones in the rooms are horrible with no power at all and you should have some on hand via room service that actually work.)

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: J R
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed there for a long weekend at the end of May, 2011. Our room was on 7th floor and it was excellent. Three windows with small terrace behind them and the best: astonishing view straight to Eiffel tower! The room came with upgrade included in package, so we were a little lucky. Breakfast was from 7 am until 2 pm, at least during weekends and it was great. As a finnish citizen I of course went to sauna...it is nice, but not as hot as the typical finnish sauna. But there is TV! Defenitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: tker48
Reviews.Content: You can walk to the hop on hop off from here. The staff is pretty friendly. The heater in our room was not working so they were nice enough to bring us a portable heater. The rooms were clean and spacious. The gym here is small but has it all. A couple of good restaurants to your right once you come out of the door.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: facca
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is wonderful. It is the smallest Hyatt in the WORLD! The service is amazing, the staff very accommodating to American's. Coffee is very good, lobby restaurants are lovely. That said meals are VERY expensive; but there are amazing restaurants and bakeries within a 5 minute walk in any direction. If they lowered their food rates the restaurant/cafe business would increase because the food and setting are incredible. Unfortunately they are driving guests away from their wonderful dining experience. Room size is spacious by Paris standards. If you have the points or can afford the pricey rate you will be delighted to stay here and to enjoy the accommodating staff. Child friendly as well, gets 5 stars from my 5 year old.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: marbellarentabike
Reviews.Content: Good service, very clean, very centric, wonderful decor. The only but... the size of the room, a bit too small for my taste. Either then that, HIGHLY recommended.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, lousy internet”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdammer1804
Reviews.Content: the hotel is expensive but ok. the internet is a pain. it iis not free and of poor quality

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: WarsawExplorer
Reviews.Content: One night only, chosed due to location only, close to office and center of Paris, but paying almost 300 Eur per night excl breakfast at 32 Eur was painful. Excellent service, nice personell, good breakfast quality but ... If you looking for one night only find cheaper place I suggest.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jorginho33
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at this beutiful hotel, staff is very friendly and multilingual. Had breakfast every morning and had a great begining for the day. So difficult to take taxis though. Not the hotel fault but it was anoying.

Reviews.Title: “NOT American Friendly”
Reviews.Author: taylor-reviewer
Reviews.Content: I had a lot of issue with my stay. The rooms are tiny to start. So they roll in a bed which takes up all walking room. If you rearrange the beds to get more room, every morning they put them back to the original layout. After a day out walking with the kids, having to rearrange my room each evening was not desirable. The food in their 5* restaurant was about a 1*. One morning the hard boiled eggs looked old, so I marked it with a speck of jam. That egg came back for the next four mornings. The fruit was old as well. I stuck to the bread and jam. In the spa downstairs they have all this great looking stuff but it doesn't work. a fancy tea brewer that doesn't brew. a great looking steam room that doesn't steam. it's all clean and looks good, but it is useless. The concierge who arrange my trip to the Eiffel tower ended up charging me for two days of tickets and I still (2 months later) have not been reimbursed. The maid service was bizarre. If you left clothing items on your bed, it was gone that day. I had them call the laundry service for 4 days to get my stuff back to no avail. I ended up having to throw everything into the closet before I left each morning which defeats the purpose of relaxing on my vacation. Oh yes - don't take the cab service from the hotel. They tell you to wait for their service, but those guys are so mean and rude. They clearly don't like Americans. I had a fight with one of them who wouldn't give me change. I had to leave without my change. While waiting, I watched another hotel guest fighting with their cabbie for change. This was unacceptable for the price we paid for this apparently higher end hotel - mostly lower end is my opinion now.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in great Right Bank location”
Reviews.Author: Cathy W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here Sept. 1-4, 2011, pleasure trip. Outstanding property in great Right Bank location. Very close to Eglise Madeleine and Eglise St. Augustin and their Metro stops. Walked to Opera Garnier, Place de Concorde, Lourve, Tuleries, etc. Surrounding streets have endless places to shop or eat. Staff is wonderful, friendly and professional. As a Gold Passport member, we got complementary in-room coffee each morning, and we added on breakfast which was delivered promptly and courteously. The Concierge was extremely nice and helpful with dinner reservations one night and also took care of our boarding passes upon check-out. Both were waiting for us in our room after a day of sight-seeing. A high level of service is this hotel's stock in trade. Two other things we liked very much: requested room over-looking "courtyard" (very small) which was very quiet at night. Also enjoyed the lobby bar/living room with coffee-table books to browse, comfy places to sit or work, with beverages and bar menu, and very attentive staff. It is under a glass ceiling in the courtyard, so you can sit there even if it's raining. So cozy and relaxing after the hustle/bustle of the streets of Paris. Our room/bath was very nice and comfortable, too. We would stay here again. Hint on getting there: We used the Roissy Bus, about 50 min. trip. 10 Euro one way, can buy ticket on bus with credit card. We went from CDG to the Opera Metro stop, then took Metro to Madeleine stop. But lots of walking with suitcases on crowded streets, and many stairs in Metro. We had the hotel call a taxi on the return trip to the Roissy Opera stop. But Roissy is definitely the way to go, instead of the RER when staying here. They run every 10-15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Another pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: lottie75
Reviews.Content: I'm back again at the Hyatt for work. I'm in room 406 which faces the main road but good sound proofing. Lovely staff at the front desk. I've always been a bit disappointed with room service (my 7th stay this year) and i recommend Au Gourmet Imperial for low key Vietnamese/ Chinese dinner. 2 blocks north on left hand side street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Quiet, Upscale Property”
Reviews.Author: jp7124
Reviews.Content: A very small, but nice Hyatt Regency. In fact, I felt the small size was its biggest advantage as you avoided the typical Hyatt Regency convention hotel feel. The hotel was located near Place Madeleine and a short 5 minute walk to Hermes, Chanel, Ferragamo etc. My deluxe room was very large, modern and up to date by Paris standards. Although it has 5 stars, I felt it was more like a 4.5. Nothing bad to say about my stay here. It is a smart choice for a tranquil Paris stay.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, pleasant and trouble-free”
Reviews.Author: ibscotty
Reviews.Content: I like to complain, but there was nothing to complain about at this hotel for me. Nice rooms and actually reasonably sized for Paris. Service was very polite and trouble-free. The location is great too - close to shopping in Madeleine, restaurants at place de la concorde and Champs Elysees area. Oh, not far from the Louvre, Orangerie, etc. Didn't eat there - why eat at a Hotel in Paris anyways ?

Reviews.Title: “Central Location - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: K1ngG_U_S
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms. The hotel is a very short Vespa or Velib ride from all of the Paris attractions. The staff was very friendly. The internet was pricey and they would only allow you one device for that price. A can of coke out of their fridge was 5 Euro. Yikes!! I would say their crazy prices and internet policies were negative enough to have me look elsewhere in Paris for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Other Thing Better than the Hotel Were the People”
Reviews.Author: Smith614
Reviews.Content: Nearly everyone spoke English, but didn't cringe when I tried to speak French! Great value, nice rooms, great location. Definitely one of the better hotel stays I've had lately!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: L D
Reviews.Content: Although it costs more, the hotel is gorgeous and the room is a good size. The location is terrific--within walking distance of major sites and shopping. It's worth the splurge for the both the location and the excellent quality of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: gwera
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during our vacation in France in May of 2010. We arrived in the morning from the US and our room was not yet available. However, we were given access to the gym/spa to shower and freshen up. Eventually we got our room and were satisfied. By European hotel standards it was modern and clean. The room was a little small and it was behind an extra door with another room adjacent (that was occupied by a noisy late night neighbor). The location is excellent with the Eglise du Madeleine nearby plus the Place de la Concorde, Metro, and Rue de Haussmann all walk able. The concierge staff gave us a number of fine restaurant recommendations/reservations and helped us to have a very memorable experience in Paris. They also helped us book an excellent Loire Valley tour and we made friends with other hotel guests along the way. In addition, we took a night off in the room where we enjoyed room service, movies, and local wine. The negatives: The front desk is always congested and lacked the “can do” or “it’s a pleasure” attitude I expect from nice hotels. In the little room adjacent to ours we had a noisy neighbor who neither the management or I could keep quiet. Finally, on checkout we were charged for a night that was supposed to be free (we had booked under a promotion to bring us back to Hyatt resorts connected with the loyalty program). I always appreciate an upgrade or complementary night but don’t make me beg for it at the desk. Overall, this is a classy place with a strong concierge staff but a few bumps in the road during our stay. The usual Paris hotel prices are here too of course.

Reviews.Title: “Get a hyatt credit card for an annual fee of 75 dollars and stay at this hotel for 2 free nights”
Reviews.Author: jhb18
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel No criticisms except if I had to pay for it out of pocket

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Plasticchips
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, beautiful rooms with lots of space. Bottled water provided in rooms everyday a plus. Full stocked mini bar. Dining area excellent with really good food! Hotel walking distance to Tour bus. Cafe was really nice also. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful services!”
Reviews.Author: gracie0408
Reviews.Content: Arrived the hotel with warm welcome from the front desk. Room was spacious and cleaned. Breakfast was ok but the staffs were all really wonderful with great help. the only thing was the TV in our room kept turn on by itself in middle of 2nd night we were there that really bothered me a lot because I couldn't sleep and no.. I didn't use it as alarm and the 1st night was fine.. so not sure what had happened. great location.. and easy access to places.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal200
Reviews.Content: We used frequent flyer points for our room, so don't know about cost, but it was WONDERFUL! Beautiful room, great location, warm and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: bobbyjohn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April, 2011. Room was clean, spacious for Paris, pricey at ~$550/night. The staff (front desk) was young and very eager to please. No parisian diffidence. Location near Place Madeleine was convenient to much of Paris. 3 blocks from Metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hyatt experience in Paris”
Reviews.Author: floricuse
Reviews.Content: Was in Paris for six nights for combo business meeting / leisure trip with wife. Good, but not great location, boutique-style hotel, near multiple Metro stations...10 minute or less walk to Opera, Galleries Lafayette, Concorde, Jardin Tulleiries, etc. Would have been five stars with the exception of two issues: 1. Rooms are a big dated...walls marked up, carpets stained, etc. 2. Had to asked 4 times for the shower drain to be unclogged...they sent someone each time, but still didn't address properly until the 4th time. Staff overall very attentive and friendly. Manager actually came out at the end to make sure our stay was ok upon our departure. Rooms decent size, small (and I mean tiny) balconies, clean rooms, etc. Would recommend for both business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable stay, with professional service”
Reviews.Author: nhentschel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was in a good location and we could stay on AMEX points. This was our last hotel of a slightly more than 2 week trip, and we wanted to stay in a large (by Parisian standards) room with a true king size bed. We booked a deluxe king which met those needs, with first rate bed and bath linens. There is no concierge desk so it appears that everyone at the front desk helps, and for the most part, the staff is friendly and professional. The hotel is located within easy walking distance of some of Paris's most expensive shops, and the hotel's clientele took advantage. Like one of the other reviewers we are more of a 3-4 star family in a hotel where the clientele seems like they are accustomed to 5 star treatment. That makes for some interesting people watching. One of the only cons, is the breakfast. It was included in our room rate so we ate at the hotel It's a decent breakfast but far too expensive. We had better bread and breakfast pastries in the hotels we stayed in the French countryside. There did not appear to be too many breakfast options in the immediate vicinity but that may have been that we were there over a holiday and the restaurants were not uniformly open.

Reviews.Title: “Unpretentious, gorgeous, professional, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Chuck, Santa Cruz
Reviews.Content: This hotel would normally be out of our financial reach (we're more of a 3-star family), but it was a genuine pleasure to stay at the Hyatt for two nights. We took advantage of the Hyatt credit card offer which gives you two nights in exchange for getting a new card. The hotel is very subtle from the street, with a very small entrance which expands as you enter into what used to be a courtyard. Lovely furnishings, friendly staff (great English skills!) and quiet elegance. Our room was very nice, with a queen-size bed with a soft comforter. Free Wifi (if you're a Platinum member) and a beautiful bathroom with tub/shower. The only downside was the cost of breakfast. We were looking for some great French coffee, and ended up getting charged 32Euro apiece for a relatively simple continental fare. I know we should expect that in Paris, at a nice hotel, but it still shocks me that a meal can cost that much.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Cozy Hotel in a Wonderful Parisian Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: pbsherr
Reviews.Content: First time at the Hyatt Regency Madeleine. As Hyatt's go, this a small boutique sized hotel in lovely and convenient Paris neighborhood a short walk to the Place de la Concorde and the Tulieries. The staff is truly professional, courteous and warm. We were travelling with kids. The hotel has rooms adjoining that are connected by a small private hallway. When connected is creates a little suite of rooms. Worked out brilliantly!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, comfortable, luxurious... but compact!”
Reviews.Author: srinik69
Reviews.Content: In terms of location, the Hyatt Regency-Madeleine is pretty well located. It is not a large hotel, it is cheek-by-jowl with other buildings. It has no porch, so you park the car right in front of the hotel on the road - not a good idea with Parisians crowding the Boulevard Malsherbes during peak hours. You need that valet... now! The valets are efficient - the hotel has its parking, but if its full, the vehicles are parked at the public parking. Doesn't make a difference actually. The room is superbly upholstered and the high ceiling is a sign of luxury. There is a bathtub as well as a shower cubicle - always a good idea if you dont like showering in the bathtub! The bed is extremely comfortable. The only issue with the road facing room is the noise of the traffic outside, mainly because the road is cobbled and tyre noise is pronounced. But the peak hour is not sustained, it gets quiet by 8 pm. The double windows can be opened and you can look down on the street below. There is a famous champagne bar at the hotel, but we drank beer instead! The starters you order are expensive and are tiny frou-frou bits that wont even satisfy a fly! There is a single restaurant located right at the lobby - it is too exposed. The service and the food is however excellent. They have a tiny one-person sized business centre - too bad for you if its occupied.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with very friendly, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: danoblatt
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable stay, enjoyable ambience in Chinoiserie restaurant and a small but functional, quality gym. But the best part of the stay was the incredibly attentive staff - they know your name, are very engaging but discreet and helpful. This is a fabulous hotel with staff that should be commended.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in the middle of the business district with great subway access”
Reviews.Author: Tavernrock
Reviews.Content: Awesome staff ... timely and attentive ... very, very friendly ... great effort is made to accommodate travelers from other countries ... the concierge staff is off the charts ...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service - Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bellainontario
Reviews.Content: We were really thrilled with our recent stay at this hotel - for European standards, the room was wonderfully spacious. The bathroom also was a pleasant surprise with its full tub/shower combination, fluffy North American style towels, and lovely marble surfaces. The buffet breakfast was delicious and consisted of a great variety of items to please any tastes. Delicious freshly-squeezed juice was a wonderful inclusion. (That being said, we are glad the breakfast was included in our room price as it would have been quite costly at 32E each if we had been required to pay for it on top of the room.) The service at this hotel was outstanding. All the staff were extremely friendly, professional and seemed to genuinely care that we enjoyed our stay. Whoever is managing this hotel has done an outstanding job of training their staff and should be proud of their team. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Despite 4th stay in 6 months you still get the worst room!”
Reviews.Author: lottie75
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th stay at the Hyatt Regency Paris Madeleine in the last 6 months. On this stay I am in room 109 which I do not recommend if you want to get any sleep! There are very bright lights over the glass atrium which is your 'view' that shine through the curtains making it very light in the room. As well, there is a lot of noise from the hallway. I would've hoped that my loyalty would be rewarded with a slightly better located room! Room service is a bit thoughtless - serving the hot entree, hot main and frozen dessert all at once. No heated box or suggestion for me to call when I was ready for my dessert. It is a nice hotel but I only stay here due to the convenience of my work.

Reviews.Title: “one of best Regency Hotels by Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: TravelMatt05
Reviews.Content: Not speaking French and staying in Paris can be intimidating, but the staff was very polite and everyone spoke English. Very nice rooms as well. I am a Hyatt Diamond Member and stay at lots of Hyatt hotels. This was my favorite so far. Breakfast was fantastic, which is included with Diamond, otherwise it is very pricey of course. Excellent gym with Steam room as well. Right in the heart of downtown, just blocks from the Louvre. I would stay there agin for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katrin_Z
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel in the beginning of September 2010. The hotel is situated on boulevard Malesherbes, which is in walking distance from Madeleine, Place Concorde and Saint-Honore. The whole stay was pretty good. The staff always booked the restaurants for us and was very polite. The room was decorated in mordern style. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel, however for the same price there are other equal hotels, which are more closer to the places of interests. I would rather choose this hotel for business trip than for tourist visit.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the middle of Paris”
Reviews.Author: JillHF
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in the left bank but decided to save some money and use points. Wise decision. My husband and I were absolutely thrilled with this hotel. Everyone at the front desk was incredibly helpful and courteous, answering every question with a smile. Hyatt has trained them well. The lobby is a fantastic spot for an after dinner drink. When an error was made regarding breakfast being part of our reservation, they were so apologetic and refunded half of our food bill. Everyone employed by the hotel we came in contact with was happy to share their love of this beautiful city and give directions, suggest restaurants, and help decipher the subway system. The room was quite large, dark for sleep and incredibly quiet. The bathroom was a nice size as well. The location was in between two convenient subway stops...so easy to navigate the French metro BTW...just a great find and only a 15 minute walk to the Champs Elysee and the shops of St. Honore (we only window shopped!) We love the Left Bank, but would definitely stay here if we have the opportunity to travel to Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in paris”
Reviews.Author: HongkongInvictus
Reviews.Content: Best hotel for front desk friendliness and positive attitude and behaviour. My favourite place in Paris. And it is well located close to shops and Champs élysées. For travellers who like their comfort. Great team. Keep going

Reviews.Title: “shockingly small room”
Reviews.Author: Voyager212
Reviews.Content: 8 friends stayed here, in 4 double rooms, 3 on 6th floor and one on 2nd. Review is based on the 6th floor room I slept in (which had an internal “courtyard” view) but the consensus was that things were similar in the other rooms (the 2nd floor room was bigger). The hotel is reasonably well located in the 8eme. Our room was minute. Probably the smallest double hotel room I have ever slept in. There was only room for a bedside table on one side of the bed. These tiny attic rooms in old Paris apartment buildings used to be called the "chambre de bonne" and were where the housemaid lived. The Hyatt should use them for something similar and should not be charging them out for Euros 550 a night (ie. £500 or US$800). That is the rack rate - we actually paid a rate of Euros 460 which remains dreadful value. Decoration was contemporary but bland. The bed was narrow, and presumably the smallest that can be called a "double" bed. It had a good firm mattress and the duvet and linen were fine. The ventilation system functioned, but the aircon cooling system seemed to have been turned off for the winter (we asked reception to do something and nothing happened). The room was hot, stuffy and airless. The window wouldn’t stay open but it provided some respite. There was a narrow balcony. Wifi is extra which is incredible. The bathroom was suitably small. The water pressure for the bath was so low it took 15mins to run a bath. Oddly the shower (over the bath) had good pressure. Hand towel was dirty. Good flat screen TV with MP3 jack. Poor selection of English language channels. Complimentary 1/2 bottle of red bordeaux. Service was average at best. Main lobby "lounge" area etc is small, and pleasant enough. This was poor value and a disappointing stay. There must be hotels in central Paris offering a lot more than this for this price. If we had been staying more than one night we would have kicked up a fuss about the room. We will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for shopaholics!!!”
Reviews.Author: AvniBaroda
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect for me and my girl friends who had decided to tag along with our husbands who were all in Paris for business. Our days were spent shopping and eating! The hotel's close proximity to the main shopping districts and Champs Elysees allowed us to walk everywhere, which was great, especially as getting a taxi in Paris can be near to impossible during the evening rush hours. Although a little small, the hotel lobby was extremely welcoming and there was always a member of staff willing to help with our many inquiries regarding sightseeing and restaurants. Breakfast was served in the cozy coffee shop which served great omelets and had the most comfortable sofas to chill on. The rooms were fairly big and the bathrooms modern and huge which was great. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Paris for some retail therapy and luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, comfortable, intimate, well-located”
Reviews.Author: garyfong
Reviews.Content: Great tub, beautifully decorated. Soft linens, great location, intimate feel. Wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious hotel”
Reviews.Author: zig123
Reviews.Content: This hotel successfully combines a certain French flavor with the usual upscale European Hyatt experience: the building and lobby are elegant without being ostentatious, as is the hotel in general. It is easy to walk by the entrance without noticing it on its busy boulevard, yet the inside is quiet and peaceful, as it would be in an 'hotel particulier'. My courtyard facing room was eerily quiet, probably the quietest hotel room I have ever had in Paris, with not a noise to be heard. As a result, I slept extremely well. While I understand there is quite some variation between rooms due to the age of the building, mine was vast with high ceilings, lending an extremely spacious feel. Furniture, linens, and TV were up-do-date and of high quality. The hotel is centrally located, in an area that feels more residential than the lowest-numbered arrondissements; as a result there are more shops and eateries catering to locals than to tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: FlyBonanza
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for four nights. The hotel is not big, the lobby is nice with good food and expensive drinks (like all hotels of the same category). Our room had a reasonable size, not too big but definitely not small. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom excellent with a good sized shower plus a bathtub. I am not sure all rooms have the same big bath since this was in a corner. My only complain is that a lot of light can be filtered from the curtain edges and it was impossible to get it completely dark. The service from all the personnel was excellent, above average and we felt that they really cared to provide a good service to us. I had another reservation for the Renaissance Arc de Triomphe after our trip to the Cote D' Azur and I was sorry it was not again on this hotel. The good thing is that the Renaissance was a great surprise too and turned out to be another excellent option on a very good location in Paris. (the internet is not free on the rooms but they have a good little business center with free internet on their computer)

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: jamsmith70
Reviews.Content: For my 40th birthday this year my (very generous) company offered me a long weekend in Paris, including a return ticket on Eurostar and a room in the Hyatt Regency, just behind Place de la Madeleine. It was one of the best presents I’ve ever had! The weekend was fantastic, and the hotel was great - from the outside it looks very French but inside the décor is more Asian, with lots of black wooden furniture and orchids in the entrance and the lounge. The bedrooms were less Chinese in style but very luxurious in white and beige with a huge ensuite bathroom (all good except for the useless hairdryer – don’t even bother). On their website they showed a view of the Eiffel tower from one of the bedroom windows – I didn’t have that – my bedroom overlooked the internal courtyard, but at least it was very quiet not facing the main road. The staff were extremely helpful, particularly the receptionists who offered advice or looked up information on everything I wanted to see and do in the city. The only thing I can’t comment on is the food as, being in Paris for only 3 days, I ate out everywhere (best meal Café Prunier, best view Café de l’Homme, best music & bar Buddha Bar).

Reviews.Title: “Elegegance private style”
Reviews.Author: frankweckesser
Reviews.Content: A smaller Hyatt Hotel suggesting privacy. The style in Black and Gold is special. Our standard room was upgraded and the one we got was nice (approx 30 sqm) but this is what i would call a standard 5 star requirement., So the smaller basic room surely too small like always in Paris. Space sold highly epensive. Great Bathroom, nice creamy colours and what we loved two huge window opening on a balcony showing to Bd. Malesherbes. Great Beds like always in hyatt . The Hotel is in the middle between saint augustin and madeleine.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home, in an elegant setting”
Reviews.Author: pmmnc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the epitome of service. The staff was always happy to help you. Everybody greeted you by your name throughout your visit. The rooms are elegant and very comfortable. The lobby has a quiet sophistication about it that always welcomes you at the end of the day. This hotel was a big part of making our trip great.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: whereish
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a regular room and it was much smaller than I expected considering the price, but the room is very comfortable and clean with nice generic modern furnishings. Tight but efficient space but the high ceilings didn't make it feel claustrophobic. Washroom and shower was spotless and clean, although the slightly see-through glass door is a bit too modern and impractical for my tastes. Staff is excellent and attentive (almost overly so to the point of getting creepy) and lobby and entrance are small but efficient and sleek looking. Location wise, it's between two metro stations and near enough to the Paris Opera and shopping at the big department stores (Printemps and Galaries Lafayette) and about a 20-30 min walk to Champs Elysees. The only thing with being in such a nice neighbourhood was the lack of restaurant options nearby, and mostly had to walk maybe 15-20 min to get a bigger selection (towards the department stores from what we could figure out). And because it seemed like more of a commercial area, some nearby restaurants and services were closed on weekends. Considering the hotel is on a major street, it was surprisingly quiet, and just off the tourist path enough to avoid the regular tourist traps.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally wonderful visit”
Reviews.Author: emedclimb
Reviews.Content: I was here for two nights, in a suite one night and a regular room the next. The hotel is located in a safe and upscale neighborhood. Metro station a few blocks away. Though the lobby has a stark and modern look, the rooms/suites have a very opposite feeling about them (warm, inviting, and very comfortable. i could easily move in for a month and not go crazy). My suite and room did face the interior courtyard and were very quiet. I must give credit and thanks to the staff, however. Every staff member that I interacted with was wonderfully receptive and accomodating to this non-French speaking tourist. I have been fortunate to stay at some very nice hotels and I will always remember this as being a very special one. Ken

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Schadenfreudelicious
Reviews.Content: Spent four perfect days at the Hyatt Madeleine and could not have been happier with the service and location of the hotel...Enjoyed a lovely room on the 7th floor with its own balcony and view of the Eiffel Tower. The staff are friendly and go out of their way to help with directions, hailing cabs and restaurant recommendations. The hotel is perfectly located for sight seeing and shopping...The amazing Fauchon and Lauduree are close by, as are a staggering assortment of cafes, bistros and shops. The train and subway are a stones throw from the hotel, and its an easy walk to the Place de la Concorde, Louvre, even Notre Dame and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “A stay to remember and hopefully repeat”
Reviews.Author: marlboroughLondon
Reviews.Content: Considering we were using points, we were so impressed by the welcome and service. We imagined we might be hidden away but quite the reverse. We were upgraded and as requested the rooms were adjoining and really beautiful. There was no criticism and for a real treat we would love to come again. The position is great and being so near the shops for a teenager was sheer heaven. The weather was perfect and we found ourselves doing things we had never done before such as a boat trip in early evening on the seine followed by an excellent bistro recommended by the hotel. Seeing the water lilies by Monet at L'Orangerie added a little art and since we were only there for one night we managed to walk our feet off and loved every moment of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Sidney6
Reviews.Content: Victoria, B.C. Canada. We stayed at this hotel for 5 days before starting our France tour. Do not be put off by any negative reviews. We found the staff so helpful and polite. If you requested anything, they were at your door within minutes. Staying at this hotel was a great start to our France tour. The location was very good for sight seeing and shopping. We will definately stay here again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Its 5-Star Rating”
Reviews.Author: drieldc
Reviews.Content: My husband & I came to France to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary in the Loire Valley. We stayed at the Hyatt Madeline on the weekends before and after our tour. The Hyatt Madeline is located on an area bordering the 8th & 9th Arrondissements and has the advantage of both. There are metro stops within easy walking distances: Saint Augustin to the north and Madeline to the south. It is close to Boulevard Haussman with its major department stores and attendant shops and brasseries and, in the other direction, a 15 minute stroll will take you to the Place de la Concorde and several designer boutiques. I understand the neighborhood is also the Financial District -- there are several small eateries around to cater to local business people. Photos here and on the hotel's own web site are accurate. The facilities are luxurious. We had an Executive Room on the sixth floor, directly beneath the top floor, which is itself the Presidential Suite. Furnishings were in excellent condition -- the room was tastefully decorated with light cherry wood and cream walls. Our bed was very comfortable. The entire room was well laid out and the bathroom provided a deep tub with separate shower and plenty of hot water. The television/entertainment center provided a good array of channels in several languages -- five for English -- as well as movies and musix. I loved the exercise room -- our fitness center at home (L.A. Fitness) is barely a year old and they could take a lesson from this hotel. Equipment was fantastic and quite sophisticated. If you want access to the internet, there is a charge: 12 euros for 12 hours and 18 euros for 24 hours. This is pretty much what you have to pay elsewhere so, while pricey for non-Europeans, it is not out of line. We were very impressed by the cleanliness of both our room and the entire facility. All areas are immaculate. We would leave our room for breakfast and see the occasional room service tray in the hallway outside of a door. By the time we returned from our meal, it would be gone. The staff takes great care and there was a supervisor who checked with us every day to make sure we'd received good service with our room. And now this brings me to the staff and it is here that I reserve my highest accolades. We planned to stay that last weekend for only two days. However, due to the volcanic eruption in Iceland and the subsequent ash cloud that grounded all flights, we found ourselves guest of this hotel for several days longer than we anticipated. We observed the daily ritual of guests checking out in the morning only to see them check back in as promised flights never materialized. Those people were tired, and upset. The staff dealt with them -- and us -- with unfailing courtesy, professionalism, and compassion. And for the most part, they did so in our languages (and I stress the plural), not theirs. The manager assured us that we could stay as long as we wanted and would not be penalized if we checked out with little notice. The doorman always wished us a cheery "Bonjour!" as we exited the hotel for our day and, after awhile, ventured to ask us how we were doing, and were we okay? The staff in the hotel's cafe always remembered how my husband liked his coffee (horribly weak and I'm sure they must have inwardly winced). They gave inspired suggestions for walks about the city to places we enjoyed and brasseries where real people went. Not one person ever betrayed what must have been going on behind the scenes with the massive disruption to their bookings. It was professionalism of the highest caliber. So what does this mean when times return to normal? It means that if I ever had to plan a meeting, host a banquet, or choose a hotel in which to stay, I'd want these people on my team. We cannot thank them enough for making what could have been a stressful and disappointing time into a delightful, if unexpected, extension of our vacation. We would enthusiastically recommend this hotel to anyone. And if the Hyatt chain gives out awards for Grace Under Fire, this hotel can claim it. It truly lives up to its 5-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Very Arrogant Staff.........but nice bed”
Reviews.Author: TrendyEnglish30
Reviews.Content: The lobby is a bit over done with lamps and table bling. The waiters tell you where to sit, imagine having that after a busy day at work or a meeting comming back to the hotel to be told where to sit after spending all your cash to stay there? Not nice. The assistant managers are extremely arrigant with or without realising it, so still not good. The taxi service is really really bad, the worst i ever experienced in any hotel. Staff are extremely paranois, while checking out they arranged for someone to check my room. while signing the receipt another woman who kept starring at me asked me where the iron was! she was on the phone to the person going through the room! As if i would steal an iron after paying 425 Euro per night for the last 10 days????? Why would i steal a fricking iron??? Anyway terrible service, paranoid arrogant staff. At one point i had an argument with the assistant manager over timing. When they say 10 minutes be assured it means 30 minutes. this happened more than 5 times! its as if time stands still there. Sorry but i am a really fussy guy, and this Hotel is really really bad. The bed was nice and the bathroom was nice. The weighing machine in the room didnt work so they replaced it....with another one that didnt work! But any company is only as good as the people in it, so for this reason i have to say one of the worst hotels i have visited.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in Paris, great Location”
Reviews.Author: texasguy321
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Paris, France. I am a gay man from Texas, and I always feel welcome at the Hyatt near Place de Madeleine. I have stayed here several times, and enjoy the location, easy access to the Metro, proximity to Rue Royale, and to Fauchon. The hotel upgraded me to a fabulous suite because they accidentally gave my room away to someone else during Paris Fashion Week. You will really love the warm atmosphere of a boutique hotel in the heart of Paris. The Cafe M is quite lovely too.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Chefren
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife had two nigths in this luxury small Hotel in rue Malesherbes-few steps from madeleine's square-and really loved it: a kind staff -Katarina-made us the most complete and kind check of ever giving us the complete list of what was included in our fare ( she told that breakfast was included even if this was not so evident on my voucher,and this was important at the check out making us save 120 euros) and making a complimentary immediate upgrade of our room.The hotel lounge is frankly luxury and chic with a great glass pyramid as ceiling ( like louvre museum) and the room was perfect with all the upper class standing hotel amenities.The bathroom was shine like a clinic with a lot of space.Breakfast very good with pastry nest and a nice buffet with a great service.Booked with otel.com and priced 574,00 eur for fri and sat nights.A great deal for what we received.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonyonholiday
Reviews.Content: I recently went for a short business trip to Paris and our French clients took care of the hotel arrangements and booked us at Hyatt Madeleine. The rooms were nice and quiet (facing an inside courtyard) and had good light even in this season. The staff was very attentive even though it seems that their front desk does pretty much everything (concierge, business center, room service ordering etc ...). The lounge was great with natural light and relaxing drinks after work and the location of the property was fantastic, a short stroll away from the "Grands Magasins" (my wife joined for the week-end) and also very close to Madeleine and rue St Honore with its many shops and restaurants. The overall experience was well within the Hyatt standard if not above the "Regency" branding of the hotel. The rates were reasonable when compared to other places in Paris but overall quite pricey still.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jturley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Paris a week ago. Our stay for 7 nights at this hotel could not have been better. It's not only beautiful, and very clean but, the location is excellent. Above all, was the staff that we encountered. Everyone went out of there way to be gracious and very accommodating to us. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. We highly reccommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again when we return. Very classy hotel in a an upscale area of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: rimen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a short trip to Paris. We booked this hotel primarily b/c we are Hyatt members and used points for a couple of the nights we stayed here. We were greeted warmly by the staff of the hotel when we arrived. Everyone spoke English and there were no problems with the language barrier. We had requested an early check in and the hotel promptly accomodated us. Our luggage was brought up to our room immediately. The rooms are small in comparison to Hyatt rooms in the US, but then again, most hotels in Europe have smaller rooms than in the US. However, the room was very clean, and still spacious enough for us to fit to large suitcases. There was an in-room safe which was helpful. We were also provided w/ bathrobes and slippers along with other toiletries/amenties... After getting ready, we headed to the front desk... the staff was very helpful and showed us how to get to the sites, etc. they also had information and could have booked tours for us, but we had already taken care of that from home. They had a business center, basically it was one computer with internet access... free of charge. so it was good enough for us to send a quick email home. The staff was absolutely wonderful.. im a vegetarian so my husband asked the staff on recommendations for dinner, keeping that in mind, and not only did they recommend restaurants, they called and set up the reservations for us. Further, they always remembered that who we were and the little things like I was a vegetarian etc. I also requested a late check out as we werent leaving Paris until the evening which they gladly accommodated and allowed us to store our luggage at the hotel until departure. Further, they were able to get us immediate taxis etc when required. I cannot speak enough of how wonderful the staff was. We had some snacks and late night drinks at the restaurant. It was decent... however, i do not recommend staying in when there are so many restaurants in the area. We never had breakfast at the hotel as it wasnt included and sometimes our tours left before the dining room had opened. However, there was a bakery/sandwich shop right across the street which was probably more affordable. The location of the hotel was perfect. It was quiet, but still busy enough that you felt comfortable walking in the evening. We were about a 10 minute walk from the Louvre and 15 minute walk from the Champs-d'elysees. Notre Dame was an additional 10 minute walk from the Louvre, but completely doable. Furthere, there were several stores, shops in the area for all types of shopping. The Eiffel Tower could have been walkable but we were in a rush and ended up taking a 5 minute taxi there. Definitely recommend doing a dinner cruise around the Siene in the evening. A wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfying and highly recommended but...”
Reviews.Author: kopela43
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent one night in Paris on our way home from the Greek islands. We stayed at the Hyatt Madeleine (on points) and we were both extremely happy with our selection. The hotel is very conveniently located (especially if you are there for one night only) and allowed us to walk to the Champs Elysees and other areas. The room was very nice--especially the bathroom. The other review I read that included complaints about the bathroom is bizarre. The tub was fantastic, as were the bath products. The only complaint we had is the fact that the front desk clerk advised us to eat at Chez Flotte (sp?) for dinner. I had expressed a desire to eat traditional French bistro food, like steak frites, in a non-super touristy place. We followed her advice and it turned out to be exactly what we didn't want. The restaurant was HORRIBLE. Do not eat there. They must get a kick-back of some sort. We both ordered the steak frites and it was quite frankly, the worst I've ever had. I had been waiting the whole trip to eat steak frites in Paris and ended up at the worst place for it. We could barely chew the meat. In addition, the service was terrible. So, the Hyatt's front desk clerks should not be recommending this place to their guests. Other than this, we loved the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: didoooz
Reviews.Content: stayed there for a couple of days with my wife, location is excellent you would barely notice that there is HYATT in the street , rooms are huge compared to other hotels in Paris. Pricey but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean.”
Reviews.Author: IslandLifeGuam
Reviews.Content: More of a business hotel, but suitable for kids. Great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: noelani81
Reviews.Content: Stayed in June, 2009 with a large group for business. Overall this was a great stay, the rooms had plenty of space and the service was excellent. There were no outlets in the bathroom which was very odd. I had to do my hair in the bedroom with no mirror. Also, a large sum of cash was stolen from a colleague. The thief actually went through the entire suitcase, found the cash in a vanity bag, and did not bother even covering their mess. I do not know how this was resolved but I'm sure not great. The location is excellent, within walking distance of plenty of cafes and shopping. I never ordered food from the hotel but I hear it was very good. They delivered bottles of water every night and the maid service was good. There is a small workout facility, I mean small. There is 1 treadmill, 1 elliptical and 1 bicycle. But, it is sufficient for a hotel gym as long as no one else is down there! This was a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “A absolutely wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: tstier5625
Reviews.Content: I can tell you that if you decide to stay at the Hyatt Madeline you will not be disappointed. The service was probablly the best we have experienced. We usually stay in five star hotels when we travel and this hotel provided better service then anywhere we have EVER stayed. The room was extremely clean and inviting. Soft tones with Huge windows looking out over the street made for a perfect vacation DO NOT HESITATE, book now..

Reviews.Title: “Loved the furnishing”
Reviews.Author: Speedy20
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a double room with my son and we enjoyed the facilities at the hotel very much. The service is above average & the location is excellent for business meeting with my associates. The furnishing in the room is fairly new and not worn out. It is not easy to find a hotel in Paris which is spacious and modern furnishing. I will stay there again for my next business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBPali
Reviews.Content: A tad expensive. Location is fairly good. Subway is only a 5 minute walk, and a Taxi stand is only a couple of minutes away. It is expensive - however the rooms are large, and comfortable. Bathroom has separate shower and tub area and marble floors etc. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid! Avoid! Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: RoundTheWorldTravel
Reviews.Content: Booked Hyatt Regency for the proximity to Madeleine, one of the nicest area in Paris. The hotel is OK overall, we liked the lobby area, the bar/restaurant and especially the cafe that serves breakfast until 1 or 2pm on weekends. The room was quite small, but you expect that in Paris. Avoid the SPA area which is a joke, and also the "massage" offering which is provided by an external company. Very bad experience. The worst moment was check-out. We checked-out, and we left our suitcases in the luggage room. We realized we forgot some clothes in the room, and requested them only two hours later when we returned to get the suitcases. At that moment we were returned everything BUT the leather jacket, the most expensive item of all. It has never happened to us to have our clothes STOLEN in a hotel before, and we would not have expected that from a Hyatt. The hotel failed to solve our issue, so our stay was ended with a bitter taste about the staff at Hyatt Regency Madeleine. Too bad for them, the property was ok overall.

Reviews.Title: “A reality check -- please!!!”
Reviews.Author: Spacrawler
Reviews.Content: I just returned from three nights at the Hyatt Regency Paris Madeleine, and overall, the reviews on this site are accurate. I would rate the property a low 4, but I acknowledge that I have no familiarity with other hotels in Paris. Perhaps it really is as good as some claim. Check in – quick, accurate but not that friendly. I was pleased that my room was ready on arrival at 1 pm. Entering the Executive King (204, right next to elevator, when I had asked specifically to be far from it), I was hit with blast furnace heat. I tried to adjust the thermostat, but could only turn it on or off with various fan settings. The room was very quiet, however, with double pane windows, but I knew that I would have to open some windows to relieve the heat. And it was very noisy with the fresh air. So I went back to front desk and asked to be moved. The room - they were happy to move me, and within a few minutes I was shown a second room, a Deluxe King, for 100 euro less a night. This room was extremely quiet, overlooking a courtyard, even with the windows open (although I agree with other reviewers about doors slamming, footsteps, construction pounding, and other interior hotel noise). The size of the two rooms seemed to be the same, although the Deluxe bathroom was bigger. It also looked a bit dingier – carpet were not that clean, there were three insufficient lights (the room was rather dark), and other than an uncomfortable desk chair, no place to sit. There was very little tabletop space, and no clock anywhere. A large flat screen TV worked the first day but did not the day I checked out. The bed was hard as rocks (much like those in China) with a nice sheets and a good duvet (but a bit hot). Wireless internet access was available for 23 Euro a day. The minibar was the move anything get charged type, but there was a small area for personal stuff. The bathroom – spacious, well-lit, sufficient towels. Tub was difficult to get in and out of and the rain shower, with water falling straight down, made it hard not to bump into the temperature water control knob. I had problems with temperature control throughout my stay (including in the shower). Whatever came out of the vents was very warm, so I opened the windows. But once the windows were open, the heating shut off. Meaning that it was have the windows closed and bake or open them up and freeze. Restaurants – Café M was the location of the continental breakfast each morning. It’s a dark, sexy space, with comfortable chairs and nice soothing music. I thought the buffet was very good, even at about 35 Euros. The attendants were polite and helpful and the food was filling and of high quality. I also ate lunch at La Chinnoserie and was pleased with the quality of the food and the service. Fitness center/spa – there is a small exercise room, a relaxation lounge, and locker rooms with steam and sauna. The Hyatt website is misleading about the services offered though. I booked a manicure and pedicure, expecting something like what you get in the US with a soak, scrub, moisturizer and massage, as well as a polish. The esthetician came in with a suitcase of equipment and I had to sit on a table like at a doctors office. I wasn’t sure about the cleanliness of the implements, and the services were really just cut, shape, and polish. Very, very expensive for this minimal treatment. Location – good, but not great, in my opinion. A few blocks from two metro stations. Sidewalks in Paris can be bumpy and uneven, which makes for strenuous walks. Monoprix is a few blocks north, good to pick up stuff so you don’t have to pay extortionist prices from the minibar. There was absolutely nothing open on Sunday. All in all, I was not bothered by the price or the size of the room, but the lack of a chair, poor lighting, little desktop space, no clock, and impossible temperature control made my stay less than satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: Hayduke
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights in late October using Hyatt Gold Passport points to pay for our room. Good thing too, for this hotel was expensive, but then everything in Paris is expensive. Check-in was flawless and the staff speaks good English. The room was large and well appointed, with a comfortable bed, very high quality Duvet, and lots of big fluffy pillows. Lots of light fixtures with nice bright reading lights. Good writing desk, though the desk chair was a little uncomfortable. There was a nice stuffed chair in the room which was good for reading. Big bathroom with good shower and large fluffy towels. Two telephones and a fancy clock/radio/CD player unit. Bottles of water were provided. There was a large Phillips flat screen TV. The room was very quiet and no outside noise could be heard. Any complaints? A couple minor ones. I took a 300 ml plastic water bottle from the minibar so I could get the bottle to use when we walked around town and after being charged 9 euros for this little bottle of water (outrageous) the housekeeping staff took the bottle and I could never get it replaced. Also as is typical at Hyatts worldwide, the Internet charges were exorbitant at 18 euros for 24 hours. Free service was available in the Business Center, but it only had one terminal and a non-standard European Keyboard that was very difficult to use. Breakfast was very expensive in the hotel at 22 euros for a "continental" breakfast of coffee and four pieces of bread, or 32 euros for one including some meats and cheeses. We only did this once, and afterward opted to go out to one of the many fine eating places only a block or two away. The cost of breakfast frightened us away from trying dinner there. But overall this was a great hotel, located conveniently to both the Madeline and St. Augustine metro stations. The staff was excellent and very attentive, and service was impeccable. If you can afford it this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Small Details”
Reviews.Author: Tamajam
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the Hyatt due to a booking snafu, and we were thrilled with the hotel. We especially loved the fact that we could exchange dollars into euro without a service fee. The turndown service included 2 bottles of Evian on the bedside tables. We were able to choose the English language Herald Tribune for delivery in the morning so we could keep track of US news (along with CNN and BBC on TV). There are several brasseries in walking distance for dinner with great dinner options (we found the hotel options a little pricey). Monoprix up the street is a great resource for snacks, extra bottled water, and juice. It was perfect for my husband and me, but may not be a good fit for families.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expections”
Reviews.Author: and_beyondChicagoIL
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel, it is on the scale of a boutique hotel but it is a Hyatt. We had just come from a Mandarin Oriental in Switzerland and my expections were not that high for this Hyatt hotel yet it was far superior to the Mandarin. The service here was fantastic. Every single staff member went out of their way to accomodate every request we made. The rooms are quite large and well appointed. We were traveling with our mother and they put us in two corner rooms that we were essentially able to turn into a suite with a private adjoining hallway. I can't say enough about this hotel. The location is great, very accessible to everything but not right in the middle of all the tourist traffic. ++++

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel right in the middle of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Wereldreizigster
Reviews.Content: Went on a shopping trip with a friend and this hotel was great for that purpose..we could easily walk to Galerie Lafayette and the other main shopping streets. Also on walking distance to Buddha Bar..which we went too in the evening.. Room was a bit small, but everything we needed was there and the staff was very welcoming and kind..

Reviews.Title: “Very very good choice for Paris”
Reviews.Author: cyril1980
Reviews.Content: Was in Paris just for one night for a business dinner. I chose this hotel because of the brand name and the location. I was not disappointed. Excellent (i.e. smiling and efficient) staff at the reception. Large room, which is difficult to find in Paris (although that was expected at the Hyatt, for 390 euros). Very large flat-screen and swiveling TV. I had a siesta around 5-7 PM and then I went out to dinner. When I came back the room was cleaned, the bed was made and everything (included my stuff) was in the right place. Overall experience: excellent. I rated this hotel four stars instead of five because I wasnt able to test other aspects of the hotel (business centre, bar, breakfast, gym, if there was one). But as far as I could see this was basically perfect. I would insist in particular on the staff, the service and the size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: travelaid
Reviews.Content: Centrally located within easy walking distance of the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, fabulous shops and excellent restaurants (Maxim's is just around the corner!), this hotel was a real treat to stay in. With a very stylish and modern bar/foyer area, the real surprise was the size of the deluxe rooms and the ensuite bathrooms. We were travelling in a party of eight and most of us had stayed in Paris before - without exception we all agreed that the rooms were the best we had stayed in for this calibre of hotel. The only criticism, if you could call it that, was that the breakfast was expensive (we had booked on a 'bed only' basis but two couples tried the breakfast one morning). However, there were plenty of cafes nearby where we could get a croissant and ad lib coffee. The staff were most helpful throughout our stay and the hotel website has a great "concierge" facility through which we booked transport from the airport when we were making our reservations. Overall, we would all recommend this hotel, particulary for couples wanting to experience the best of Paris virtually on the doorstep - a highly enjoyable experience. We won't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: CTCTraveller
Reviews.Content: A very small Hyatt right in one of the best districts of Paris. Because of this, its pricey. However, because its small (they say its the smallest Hyatt in the world) it gives a very personal touch to service which is nice - makes one feel at home which is not a common feeling in Paris! Rooms are very comfortable and well equipped although the Air Conditioning in mine didn't work!! There is a bit of a shortage of dining outlets but what there is is good. Its probably best to eat out. Well worth a visit if you are looking for a smaller, friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; good service; comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: craig_ng
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two night in October 2007. The hotel is undergoing renovations on the exterior, so the hotel entrance is covered in scaffolding, but other than that, the renovation had little impact on our enjoyment of the property. The staff are friendly and efficient - check in was relatively seamless. The hotel is quite small. The reception and lobby area are both quite small, but I suppose not unusual for Europe. The rooms are small but very nicely furnished and very comfortable. There is a small spa/sauna in the basement, but it was not particularly inviting or well-patronised. The best thing about this hotel is perhaps its location in the heart of very cosmopolitan Madeleine.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location. Tiny room.”
Reviews.Author: Sheepish_too
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend here while watching the end of the Tour de France. The hotel is quite convenient for the central sites, but a little way from a decent choice of bistros. There is some refurbishment going on which means only one restaurant is open, but there was no noise (or any sign of) workmen. But then it was France, on a weekend. For 380€ I thought the room was tiny, but well presented. Compared to, for example, the Hyatt Great Eastern in London where we stayed at the beginning of July, where the room was about 3 times the size for nearly half the price. We did get a 50cl bottle of red wine and a bottle opener as a welcome present, although I haven't tried it yet so couldn't comment on that. The reception staff were perfectly nice, and service at breakfast was fine. Breakfast was everything we wanted, but not the range you might find in other Hyatts. We ate dinner in the Hotel's Cafe M on Sunday night. For 190€ including 4 glasses of wine I thought it at best average. My braised beef was very hot and with a slight film on the liquid suggesting it had been too close to a microwave. The female waiter suggested a good wine match for my starter, but her male colleague clearly had no idea about matching desert wines which weren't remotely sweet and didn't work at all with our choices.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt is just a hyped (and expensive) travelodge”
Reviews.Author: GillSans
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two years ago and had a great stay - good room, nice service, and free minibar on the "deal". This time, however, standards had slipped, and I now had a dingy and too-small-for-the-680euros-price room (which, honestly, is no bigger than a travelodge room with an oversized bathroom). Complained, but no help - that was the price for a night - and now all I can hear is sex from the next room (which you can also hear from the corridor as the room gives right onto it (no entrance way), the TV doesn't work and the staff are just too officious for their own good. It's a shame as the last stay was perfect - I fear they are a bit too precious about themselves now. I like the ambience here, it's just the rooms and the people - I heard two more people complaining at reception. Plus 110 euros for a lobster dish in the restaurant? pah.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Cherish
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my last trip to Paris with my sister and parents. We had two rooms on the same floor. Surprisingly, for European standards, our room was quite large. And it was modern yet stylish. The bathrooms are huge and comfortable and the service was very good. Maybe not as wonderful as the Plaza Athenee where we stayed before, but definitely pleasant and helpful, and not at all snobbish like some reviewers stated. For what we paid (around 350 Euro) the hotel is first class and the location is excellent- close to everything, but on a quiet street. Well worth it and I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong, but a bit bland”
Reviews.Author: RJB
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night in a deluxe room for the rather scary rate of Euro 455, room only. The room is very modern with a flat screen TV, in typical Hyatt style (ie huge bathroom, with a massive stand alone shower, with smaller than usual bedroom). There is nothing wrong with this place - the room looks like it was refurbished very recently, and the location is great for tourists. It is very bland, though, especially compared to somewhere like InterContinental LeGrand nearby which takes your breath away and is a far bigger property. Some odd things put me off as well - my room overlooked the central courtyard which led to a slight problem with light from the spotlights outside. The TV was also unplugged when I got into the room, and the check-in guy was convinced I had stayed there before!
