("Welcome back", "this time you are on the 4th floor") Nice touches were the free newspapers in the lobby (although I wouldn't have needed one if the newspaper I had requested had actually been delivered to me) and free internet in the tiny business centre - but there is only 1 PC. Overall, you won't have any major complaints here but you won't be rushing home to tell your friends about it either. I recommend it mainly for anyone who insists on a modern, fully refurbished room when they travel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: LaVida
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were polite and attentive. The rooms were clean, beautiful and well kept. We received an adjoining room for our children with a shared entry way that was an excellent arrangement for family accomodations. The guest relations manager was excellent and went above and beyond in making arrangements for us. The hotel is in the heart of Paris and within walking distance of the Louve, Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides, even Notre Dame (if you are not in a hurry). The hotel is also just a few blocks from the Madeleine square where you can connect with several of the subway lines. I'd highly recommend purchasing a six day subway ticket if you are going to stay for a week or more -- the subway is easy and goes everywhere. Don't miss breakfast in the nearby Cafe Madeleine -- it's charming and wonderful. We'll definitely stay at this hotel when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: lylescovell
Reviews.Content: MY husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Madeleine for a long weekend and truly could not have had a more perfect experience. The hotel is absolutely lovely. It only has 86 rooms so you get the best of both worlds- the boutique charm and size size coupled with the professionalism and care of a major worlwide chain . The decor is great -- a modern yet comfortable Parisian look. Our room was just fabulous with a large king size bed with crisp white linens, feather pillows, and a feather duvet. The drapes were plush and oversized giving the modern room a very warm feel. There was a huge flat screen TV and movies on demand along with your basic international channels like BBC and CNN etc. The room has high speed internet access if you need to bring work with you or their business center has free internet as well. The bathroom was amazing with mirrored walls and marble flooring. There was a huge jacuzzi tub and a seperate shower with great water pressure. We had a view of the Eiffel Tower which was so incredible to see at night when we were getting ready for the evening. The staff is just so helpful and FRIENDLY (don't listen to the rumors about mean Parisians) and go out of there way to make your stay great. Ask for the concierge, Aurore Dinis, if you go. She sat down with us for a glass of champagne when we arrived to help us figure out where we should eat each night etc. She made all the bookings for us and her suggestions could not have been better. She even helped us with a personal errand on her day off after we left because my husband bought something in the wrong size --so she exchanged it for us and had it sent to us the next day! Now that is service. We have been alot of places and have never been treated so well. They convert their sitting area in to a restaurant for meal times which is so great because you feel like you are eating in your living room. We had breakfast at the hotel every morning and it was just fabulous. We also had lunch on our last day and it was delicious as well. The location is great. My husband and I walked everywhere on our trip because the weather was nice (It is about a 10-15 minute walk to the Louvre) and felt like that was a sight in its own. Just walking through the streets of Paris is a joy so it makes the effort worth the while. Plus, then you can eat all the french food you want. However, apparently their metro is great. We could not recommend this hotel more highly. Finding the perfect hotel in a huge city can be hard, but trust me, this is it! Look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Mazza&Fazza
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel was poor for the price paid. Staff at the front desk tended to be supercilious and arrogant and one staff member even made fun of their "whining American guests". Part of the package included a fruit basket being delivered nightly to the room; when asked why we were not recieving it, we were turned away by staff member who told us that that we were not entitled to it! Staff would make assertions that certain things had been done etc, without checking if things had been done. In other words, appearances seem to be more highly valued than actually being helpful. Further, the staff booked a French speaking tour for us, even though we only speak English. Breakfast was extremely limited, only the basics were provided and one of the staff serving tea would refuse to speak English and was quite testy. One morning we could hear screams and raucous laughter coming from the kitchen which is adjacent to the breakfast dining area, until a waiter had to go in and tell the chefs to quieten down. Highly unprofessional for such a "high class" hotel. On a positive note, the executive room at the Hyatt was exceptionally clean, modern and spacious and was tastefully decorated. We had a view of the Eiffel Tower from our room and there was even a box of welcome candies under the xmas tree in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: MCO-traveller
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a great location...2 blocks to Madeleine Metro and a short stroll to shops such as Printemps and Galleries Lafayette. Standard Room (used Gold Passport points) with balcony overlooking Boulevard Malesherbes was deluxe with high ceilings, luxurious bath and wonderful ammenities. Highly recommend this upscale property in the City of Lights.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Slice of Paris - Live Like The Locals Do...”
Reviews.Author: Bourdeaux
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did a two week tour of France for our honeymoon (Nantes, Bourdeaux, Avignon, Lyon, Paris)- almost three years ago. We stayed at The Hyatt Madeleine in Paris for the final leg of our journey for four nights/five days. I didn't know about this web site until recently or I would have posted our feedback after our trip. I figure it's never too late to give feedback! We really liked the style of this hotel - small, boutique and right in the middle of real French neighborhoods. We enjoyed walking around the area each morning and evening and eating at local bistros and restaurants as do the locals and shopping where they do each day. (We recall the restaurant across the street from the hotel did a great job at making a fine French ravioli dish one night - who would have thought the French could do a great pasta dish but, they did! We ended up eating there two nights due to this and the owner gave us complimentary wine and desert the second time - how nice!!!). From the hotel, it's a few quick blocks to the Place de la Concorde, Fouchons, Maximes, The Louvre, The Tuillieres Gardens, The River Seine, a Metro station and more. Great location if you ask me. Much like other reviewers, we agree the room we got was VERY small. Room for a queen sized bed, one night table, a desk/chair, tv and just enough room to pass by each other if we didn't each too much each night! The furniture, textiles etc. were all in good shape and the bathroom was top notch and modern as can be (you will give this place high marks after spending weeks throughout France and seeing what they call bathrooms in many places - holes in the ground...no wash clothes...no ice....limited towels...carpet that is like burlap to the feet and more!). LIke many hotels in Europe, the AC and heat are PRE-regulated so, don't try adjusting up and down all the time - they don't allow that as they conserve energy more than we do. The lights also don't go on unless you put in your room card - that way - when you leave, lights have to go off again - more energy conservation. We had a courtyard view - so-so. Room service was always prompt - including the food service and the cleaning staff. The front desk and concierge were very nice to us and very helpful. We especially enjoyed one bell hop who spoke many languages and was always chatty and friendly. We should have told them we were on our honeymoon and gotten a better room but, they appeared booked so, we didn't want to up and move in the middle after we had already done so much travel. We lived with it and it was fine. Like anything...try learning a little French and using it as much as you can. Even though we spoke it poorly, our attempts and smiles went a long way to good treatment both at the hotel and in the city. I had two years of French and french grandparents - that helped a bit. My husband had no French - although he did the accent poorly and massacred a few words - the French gave us two thumbs up for our honest attempts at the language and customs. We plan to return to Paris more than once to finish seeing all that we didn't before. We would consider this hotel again - just a bigger room with a better view.

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes the difference”
Reviews.Author: R1Racer
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Paris- Madeleine is a wonderful hotel. The rooms are a little on the small side, typical of European botique hotels. This 82 room gem is nicely located in the Madeleine district with great proximity to the Opera district as well as the Champs Elysees. The lobby is bright, airy and very welcoming. The breakfast is quite good although 28 Euro for continental breakfast is a bit steep. What really makes this hotel is the staff. From the reception staff at the front desk to the servers in the lobby to the housekeepers on the floors, these people were the most engaging, friendly, welcoming staff I've ever encountered. The concierge were very helpful with recommendations for restaurants as well as directions to the sites and even made SNCF reservations for us. Our stay was perfect and it was all about the people that made this hotel fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and Minuses”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the Hyatt while attending a conference in Paris. This boutique hotel should get an A+ for very tasteful decor. There is a central lobby reception area which multitasks as an all purpose bar/lounge/breakfast room and dinner hall with a beautiful glass ceiling affording a lovely nighttime view. Hotel service was friendly and competent. The health club was excellent and was always empty since no one exercises in Paris. My standard room over the central courtyard was very quiet and stylishly contemporary with high ceilings but the size of a walk-in closet. There is no dresser in the room so I used my suitcase for storage. The only room chair was at the desk. The bathroom was luxurious but lacked an exhaust fan or space for toiletries. The neighborhood is very nice and the hotel is 2 min. from the Metro. I'd go again if alone but the rooms are too small to comfortably accomodate two people. Also, check out Air India Business Class to Paris, it's wonderful and inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: mjtoal
Reviews.Content: This hotel has had varied reviews on TA, but I was pretty impressed after a recent long weekend stay. The hotel is pretty new and well located, in my view, in the 8th arrondisement, near the shopping areas on Boulevard Haussmann and Rue du Faubourg St Honore, It is 5 minutes walk from Place de la Concorde, and has good Metro links to other parts of the city. The area is quiet at night, but good restaurants and bars are a short walk away. We has a Deluxe Room, which was nicely laid out, clean and reasonable size. The bathroom was spacious with a bath and separate double shower. The room overlooked the internal courtyard and was therefore quiet. We had breakfast in the lobby area, which I thought was very nice. More relaxing to sit in than the restaurants in some hotels. The nearby Cafe M also looked very nice. The check-in and service staff were very helpful throughout our stay. I have no difficulty in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every Euro!”
Reviews.Author: madeleine mckenna
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first trip to Paris and were extremely apprehensive about the choice of hotel. We chose the Hyatt Madeleine from descriptions and photos online and couldn't be happier with our choice! This really felt like a 5-star hotel. The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful, the service left you feeling pampered (small welcome gifts, weather updates with turndown service, robes, slippers). The spa, although small, was wonderful and in six days, we had the spa to ourselves. The location is fantastic. You could literally walk everywhere, sightseeing, shopping, metro, bus tours. We had a room on the third floor facing the front with floor to ceiling windows. It really made all the difference to have a view up and down the boulevard. With so many beautiful sights to see in the city, we did really enjoy staying in the hotel as well. Would absolutely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarko2001
Reviews.Content: Once a year, my family and I like to go to Paris and stay at the Hyatt Regency Madeleine. The hotel used to be a hidden gem but is now gaining notoriety as one of Paris's secret hotspot hotels. The staff are very, very attentive and friendly. If you can avoid getting the 'Queen' Room, every other room is fantastic. I'd say the Queen Rooms (because of size) are the only draw to the hotel's accomodations although they are nicely furnished and comfortable. Room 304 is an executive deluxe room and is absolutely fantastic. I can say in the past 4 stays, I've always had a good experience with the Hyatt Madeleine.
